item.title: Heavy leaf fall on pavement with heavy footfall., 27th October
item.description:
Please could the leaf fall on this heavily used route (alongside Ashburn Court) to the Tesco store and local schools be cleared. The pavement is beside a fast moving road and gets slippery when wet. Thank you. Cllr Alisa Igoe

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashburn Court, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on road, 27th October
item.description:
Someone has left a box of laughing gas on the street but also there are many shards of broken glass (probably from a vehicle break-in) on the kerb and pavement of the adjoining junction, where Cherry Tree Walk meets Eden Park Avenue, which are hazardous for pedestrians and drivers alike.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Cherry Tree Walk, Upper Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish and shopping bags, 27th October
item.description:
A few rubbish and big shopping bags. The foxes are starting to scatter the stuff around so it would be advisable that they were removed asap

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Way Relief Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 27th October
item.description:
Mixed rubbish has been being dumped outside my house (37 Mayflower road) several times over the past month. This week the rubbish has filled my bins (both black and green) so they are overflowing and unusable, and then placed further rubbish over the pavement around the waste bins. Further rubbish is placed here each night. It feels like the property is being targeted to make it appear like my house's personal domestic waste and not flytipping
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayflower Road, Stockwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overcrowding at street entry, 27th October
item.description:
This street needs to have a strict enforcement of parking restrictions and the restrictions must be extended to cover the school pickup times. There is no traffic warden on this street at these times, restrictions are not at all enforced and the entry into the street gets severely impacted due to pick up cars and other people who park to use high street facilities. This is hugely detrimental for the residents who are unable to use the road between 1-5pm. Kindly extend the parking restriction hours on Deepdene Road and make sure this is properly enforced and parking tickets issued for people not following these. Kindly ensure parking wardens are doing their job here
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Deepdene Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kechill Gardens need leafing, 27th October
item.description:
The pavements in part of Kechill Gardens need leafing. The leaves get very slippery when wet. There are a large number of older people in the area and they are more likely to seriously injure themselves if they slip and fall over. Please would you arrange for all the leaves to be swept up and removed as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kechill Gardens, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet
